Package hr.fer.zemris.java.webserver

Class RequestContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.webserver.RequestContext

  • public class RequestContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The class represent a server response context, that is used for generating response header, cookies and data(html, text, ...). The context uses parameters which are either given to the server through a http request, cookies or set from a script(temporary parameter).
    Author:
    Dorian Ivankovic

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  RequestContext.RCCookie
      Cookie used to save session's parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestContext

        public RequestContext​(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> persistentParameters,
                      java.util.List<RequestContext.RCCookie> outputCookies)
        Constructs a new RequestContext using all relevant parameters.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - - output stream used for writing request data
        parameters - - parameters of the request
        persistentParameters - - persistent parameters (obtained from cookies) of the request
        outputCookies - - ouput cookies of the request

      • RequestContext

        public RequestContext​(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> persistentParameters,
                      java.util.List<RequestContext.RCCookie> outputCookies,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> temporaryParameters,
                      IDispatcher dispatcher)
        Constructs a new RequestContext using all relevant parameters.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - - output stream used for writing request data
        parameters - - parameters of the request
        persistentParameters - - persistent parameters (obtained from cookies) of the request
        outputCookies - - ouput cookies of the request
        temporaryParameters - - temporary parameters of the context
        dispatcher - - used to dispatch requests to other url's
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if outputStream is null

      • write

        public RequestContext write​(byte[] data)
                     throws java.io.IOException

        Writes data to the outputStream by generating the header if the header hasn't already been generated.

        The header consists of protocol, status code, status message and header properties such as content-type, cookies, mime-type,...
        Each line must be terminated by \r\n and the header must be separated from the actual data using \r\n\r\n.
        Parameters:
        data - - data to write
        Returns:
        context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the data couldn't be written

      • write

        public RequestContext write​(java.lang.String text)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the text using charset encoding, for more details see write(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        text - - text to write to the output
        Returns:
        context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if the text could't be written to the output

      • write

        public RequestContext write​(byte[] data,
                            int offset,
                            int len)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the data from buffer starting at offset and then taking len bytes using write(byte[]) method.
        Parameters:
        data - - data buffer
        offset - - offset of the staring byte to write to the output
        len - - len of the bytes to write to the output
        Returns:
        context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the data couldn't be written
